misdeed: A series of bizarre livestock deaths has left the inhabitants of a remote farm terrified. Animals are found drained of blood, their carcasses twisted at unnatural angles and bearing strange, acidic burn marks.
solution: The Vaesen is a Lindworm and can be slain by tricking it into slithering through three separate bonfires.

clues.description: The killings occur only on clear nights, when the moon is full and the stars are bright.
The ground near the slain animals is scorched and barren, the vegetation withered and blackened.
A single, massive track is found near the bodies, suggesting a creature of immense size and weight.
Local legends speak of a fire-breathing serpent that dwells in the nearby mountains, demanding tribute from those who live in its domain.
A shepherd claims to have seen a creature of immense size silhouetted against the moonlit sky, its eyes glowing with an unnatural light.
An ancient cave painting, hidden deep within a nearby mountain pass, depicts a fearsome serpent with shimmering scales and a white mane.

plotTwist.description: A young farmhand, ostracized for his interest in ancient lore and forbidden magic, has unwittingly drawn the Vaesen's attention with his rituals, believing he can control it.
